Authors:
Qiuyi Zhong, Yanyun Zhang, Xinyu Wang, Einar Timdal, Hede
Gong, Zizhi Wang, Lisong Wang
Title:
Phaeorrhiza (Physciaceae), a new lichen genus record to
China
Keywords:
lichenized fungi, Tibetan Plateau, taxonomy, phylogeny,
alpine biota
Abstract:
The genus Phaeorrhiza is reported as new for the Chinese
lichen biota, including the two species, P. nimbosa and P. sareptana
var. sphaerocarpa. The genus grows on soil in alpine meadows and is
morphologically characterized by a squamulose to subfoliose thallus,
rhizohyphae, and brown, Beltraminia-type ascospores. Phaeorrhiza nimbosa
has cryptolecanorine apothecia, while P. sareptana var. sphaerocarpa has
lecideine apothecia. Descriptions, a key and a phylogram of these
species are provided.
